page.title: 05Government, Swainby & Potto
page.content: The area lies within the boundaries of {Hambleton District Council.}Inside the Park, ie, south of the A172, the North Yorkshire Park Authority rules on planning. Whorlton and Potto each have five councillors. Councils consider planning matters, public footpaths, becksides, and maintenance of village services. These include weekly refuse collection, upkeep of highways and verges, street lighting, and sewage disposal. There is a sewage-treatment works at Goldgate Bridge; some houses still have septic tanks. The{Northumb- {rian Water Authority}provides mains supply from springs and is responsible for Swainby and Potto Becks; some houses have private supplies.{The NE} {Electricity Board}provides power.There is no domestic gas supply. There is a resident policeman in Swainby. Mr Leon Brittan (Conservative) is M.P.
